page.title: 19Summary:Hadleigh
page.content: The Data was collected by children between the ages of 7 and 11 and they were generally allowed to choose their own subjects. They have tended to be very unimaginative in their choice of issues and very "middle-class"in out- look.Nobody thought it necessary to write about the May Show,the big event of Hadleigh's year,and one child had to be primed to do so. The children are not "socially aware"; many of them wrote about their streets by saying "My street is nice/long/good/ pretty."No-one mentioned the footpath controversy,no-one talked about the renovation of the many old buildings. But this is representative of life in Hadleigh generally - the population are middle class in outlook,slow and satisfied - in fact typical of a Suffolk country town.
